III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/22/24, youth was noted to have two bruises on the left arm.
There are conflicting stories as to the cause. It was alleged that a
staff grabbed the youth by the arm, causing the bruising. It was
also alleged that the staff may have choked the youth. It was also
alleged that youth may have been slamming himself into the wall,
causing the injuries. There are two incident reports regarding
what happened.
Investigation Interviews:
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on July 3, 2024.
Foster Care Worker reported Youth A’s relative reported these
concerns to her. It was reported Youth A told his relative that he had
bruises on him because the staff were abusive. Foster Care Worker
reported Youth A has a history at other facilities where he would tell
his relatives the staff were assaulting him. There was no evidence
found to support the allegations at different facilities. She reported
Youth A has never disclosed to her of staff assaulting him. Foster
Care Worker reported she has no concerns with Youth A’s care at
the facility and reported the facility has reported all incidents involving
Youth A to her timely.
Youth A was interviewed via phone on June 28, 2024, in
collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS Worker and
face to face at the facility on July 1, 2024. Youth A had two small
bruises on his forearms. He reported the bruises came from Youth B
when they were in a fight over a seat on the couch. Youth A reported
staff intervened in the situation but could not remember who was
involved or when this occurred. He reported Supervisor and
Administrator are safe people to go to when he does not feel safe.
Youth A did not report any concerns about a staff grabbing or
choking him. He reported he does not like Staff 1 but could not state
2

why specifically he does not like him. Youth A reported he had no
other concerns about staff or the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 1,
2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS
Worker. Staff 1 reported he has been working at the facility for
about seven months. He reported Youth A has escalated behaviors
when he does not get his way. Staff 1 gave the example of when
Youth A does not win at a board game, he will become physically
aggressive towards anyone that he is playing with or destroy property
at the facility. He reported due to his physically aggressive behaviors
the other youth at the facility do not want to play with him, which
makes him more upset. Staff 1 reported Youth A spoke to his
relatives on the phone and told them that he was getting harmed at
the facility and Administrator would have to talk with the relative. He
reported when Youth A becomes aggressive, he will punch and
attempt to bite others. Staff 1 reported they use verbal redirection
with the youth and if the youth is a danger to themselves or others a
physical restraint can be used for safety measures. He reported
Youth A has not gone into a restraint because he will lay on the floor
when staff attempt to initiate a restraint when he is being aggressive.
Staff 1 reported he is aware Youth A does not like him because he is
a male staff, so he tries to not engage with Youth A when he
escalates because he does not want to make it worse. He stated he
will become involved if staff needs extra support but will try to not to
verbally engage with Youth A. He denied ever pushing, grabbing, or
choking Youth A. Staff 1 reported he has never heard of any staff or
youth pushing, grabbing, or choking Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 1,
2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS
Worker. Youth B reported he does not feel safe at the facility with
Youth A being here. He explained Youth A will assault others or
destroy property when he does not get his way. Youth B reported he
got into an argument with Youth A before over a seat on the couch.
He reported Youth A started to push him, so he pushed him back.
Youth B reported Youth A has tried to bite him, hit him, and choke
him. He reported staff are present when this occurs and separates
them. Youth B feels safe with staff and reported they do their job
protecting the youth. He reported he has never seen a staff grab,
choke, or push a youth at the facility.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
1, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS
Worker. Administrator reported on June 22, 2024, she was working
when Youth A was visiting with a relative at the facility. She reported
Youth A showed the relative a bruise on his forearm and told the
relative staff did this to him. Administrator reported she never saw a
3

bruise on Youth A until this day and stated Youth A did not disclose
any information about when it happened or what staff was involved.
She reported when she assisted Youth A with his bedtime routine on
June 22, 2024, Youth A stated he lied to his relative about staff
hurting him and stated he was “just joking.” Administrator reported
Youth A has his relatives on his phone call list and he will tell them
that he is getting abused by all the staff and then ask when he is
leaving the facility. She reported she has been in communication with
the relatives about his behaviors and safety at the facility.
Administrator reported Youth A does not do well when he does not
get his way or is held accountable for his actions. She reported Youth
A physically assaults staff, gets into fights with peers, and causes
property destruction in the unit. Administrator reported she has
watched video footage of all these incidents and did not see any
concerns about staff interactions with Youth A. She reported she has
not had any concerns with Staff 1 with Youth A. Administrator knows
Youth A does not like Staff 1 for some unknown reason, so Staff 1 is
encouraged to step away more when Youth A is escalated because
he does not respond well to him. She reported Staff 1 has done well
with that feedback. Administrator reported she has never seen in
person or on video footage any staff grab or choke Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 1,
2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS
Worker. Supervisor reported Youth A does not do well when he does
not get his way and told no. She reported he will become more
assaultive towards staff and peers. Supervisor reported Youth A has
never disclosed any concerns about staff assaulting, grabbing, or
choking him. She reported Youth A does not like Staff 1 but does not
know the reasoning behind that. Supervisor reported Youth A does
not like male staff, so this may be one of the reasons. She reported
she has not had any concerns with Staff 1’s interactions with the
youth and noted that he is always positive with the youth. She
reported she was present when Youth A and Youth B got into a fight
over a seat. Supervisor reported staff verbally redirected the situation
and Youth B moved away from the situation. She reported Youth A
never disclosed being in any pain and she was not aware of any
bruises on Youth A.
Youth C and Youth D were interviewed separately face to face at
the facility on July 1, 2024. Youth C and Youth D both reported
feeling safe at the facility and have no concerns with any of the staff
that work there. They both reported they never saw a staff grab or
choke a youth. Youth C and Youth D reported Youth A has been
having negative behaviors at the facility where he has caused
property damage and physically assaulted peers and staff. They both
reported they enjoy Staff 1 at the facility and feel safe with him.
4

Documents Reviewed:
- Youth A’s file- Incident reports within Youth A’s file was
reviewed and the following occurred in June 2024.
o On June 5, 2024, Youth A was upset because he
wanted attention from a staff that was busy with
another youth. He attempted to jump out a window, but
staff blocked him. Youth A bit, scratched and punched
staff. He ran out of the home and started to do property
destruction to vehicles and police were called. No
reported concerns of physical injury of Youth A was
noted.
o On June 7, 2024, Youth A attempted to pull the fire
alarm and was blocked by Administrator. He then
punched her in the face and ran outside. Youth A then
started to throw rocks at vehicles outside. When he
was heading back to the home, he punched and
attempted to bite Administrator. Police were contacted.
No reported concerns of physical injury of Youth A was
noted.
o On June 9, 2024, Youth A started to shout demands at
staff and threated to throw rocks at them. Staff 1 was
involved within this incident and attempted to calm
Youth A down when he was in the home. He attempted
a restraint with Youth A but he went to the floor as
Youth A was be assaultive towards staff and peers. He
attempted to get into a fight with Youth B. Police were
called for support. No reported concerns of physical
injury of Youth A were noted.
o On June 16, 2024, Youth A made various demands to
staff, yelling, cursing, threatening staff and peers. He
caused property destruction within the home. Police
were contacted for support. No reported concerns of
physical injury of Youth A were noted.
- Staff 1’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required trainings. He completed
CPI restraint model training on January 9,2024, and refresher
training on January 29, 2024.
- Facility Disciplinary Policy most recent revision date
November 2021- Staff are prohibited to physically punish a
youth. Examples of prohibited physical punishments include
spanking, punching, paddling, shaking, biting, spitting, hair
pulling, pinching, physical hitting inflicted in any manner upon
the body or roughly handling a child.
5

Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, all denied staff caused harm to Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
